entries.question: How can earthly governments sometimes conflict with the law of God?
entries.authorNote: The decree to worship the golden image was in direct conflict with the second commandment of God's law. Up until this time the three Hebrews had prove their loyalty to the king in every way; then they were told to break God's law. Their consciences told them that they could not do this, and they told the king so.

entries.question: In view of the king's decree what did God's sevants do?
